direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve adding options to the collection, with similar control flow and exception handling.
Both methods add elements (options or option groups) to the collection, though they handle different types of elements.
The result of getOptions() can be used to verify the state after invoking addOptions().
Both methods handle the presence of options and can throw exceptions for duplicate keys.
Both methods access and manipulate the option groups collection.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing options before adding them is a common setup step.
Adding individual options before invoking addOptions() can set up the state correctly.
Verifying the options collection after adding can ensure the correct state.
